com.ephesoft.dcma.webservice.exceptionhandler

Class RestExceptionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.web.servlet.handler.AbstractHandlerExceptionResolver
      • com.ephesoft.dcma.webservice.exceptionhandler.RestExceptionHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, org.springframework.core.Ordered, org.springframework.web.servlet.HandlerExceptionResolver

    public class RestExceptionHandler
extends org.springframework.web.servlet.handler.AbstractHandlerExceptionResolver
implements org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean
    1. Upon encountering an Exception, the configured RestErrorResolver is consulted to resolve the exception into a RestError instance.
    2. The HTTP Response's Status Code will be set to the RestError
    3. The RestError instance is presented to a configured RestErrorConverter to allow transforming the RestError instance into an object potentially more suitable for rendering as the HTTP response body.
    4. The HttpMessageConverters are consulted (in iteration order) with this object result for rendering. The first HttpMessageConverter instance that canWrite the object based on the request's supported MediaTypes will be used to render this result object as the HTTP response body.
    5. If no HttpMessageConverters canWrite the result object, nothing is done, and this handler returns null to indicate other ExceptionResolvers potentially further in the resolution chain should handle the exception instead.
    See Also:
    DefaultRestErrorResolver, MapRestErrorConverter, HttpMessageConverter, MappingJacksonHttpMessageConverter
